comments:
Build F1 + UI Head stream.

Create a project A with a file a.txt
Select the file and press "Ctrl C", "Ctrl V".
I dialog will popup asking the user for a new name.
Press cancel.
The following exception will be logged.

BTW: I liked the old behavior better. It did what the file system does. I.e. it 
would create a file called "Copy of a.txt".

The cancel works, and the error is not shown to the user, but it should not be 
failing.

As for the usability, I think prompting for the new name is better than 
generating a Copy Of..., since you always go and rename it after that anyway.
Lynne or Knut, please assess the risk of fixing this.
*** Bug 19939 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Please assess risk as Nick asks.  This is the same problem as the PR that you 
opened [Bug 19939].

Fix is simple and low risk.
Instead of throwing the OperationCanceledException in the syncExec runnable we 
would set the returnValue to null if the dialog is canceled. We would then 
throw an OperationCanceledException after the syncExec has completed, if the 
returnValue is null.

Created an attachment (id=1415)
File with proposed fix in getNewNameFor
Attached fix reviewed by LK. Needs second review.

Eduardo, could you please review the change and verify that it fixes the 
problem?
